intro: Condaminea corymbosa var. subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved condaminea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, showy yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. The subsessilis variety is distinguished by its shorter leaf stalks compared to other varieties of condaminea.
